I haven't played Madden in decades. So for me, this game is an incredible improvement over what I remember. It scratches that itch to play a football franchise simulator. Madden is so realistic at times, my wife actually watched part of the "Super Bowl" last year (M25) without realizing it was a game, lol. Tbf she's not a football person.

It's important to note, I don't play multiplayer. I'm also not good at football games, so I let the AI do a lot for me. My experience is tailored to my wants, and I can totally see a more hardcore player hating things that don't even register with me. 

I have experienced some optimization issues with the game (well-known on the discussion boards.) My setup is a 5080RTX / Ryzen 9800 / 64 GB RAM; needless to say, I shouldn't have any issues running any game on the market on max settings. I followed some user's advice and hid on-screen notifications and that fixed the issue--so it is a M26 problem. 

Lastly, I don't like the price or downloading third-party launchers. All games should be more affordable and not require you to download a launcher to play. These are minor complaints for me, but I make pretty good money. If I were a teen or less-fortunate person, $70 for a game would be pretty tough to attain.

My honest opinion is trash but good. This might be the best madden released in the past 6 years but they always decide to make problems. Everything is new, fun game, new graphics, new system, but of course ea has to make a problem that's never been a problem before. DEFENSE is horrible. I can't tell you how many games i have lost because a saftey or linebacker can't catch a pick or decide to swat the ball down. Trust me ea did good, it's actually possible to stop the run and glitched pass plays, blitzes arn't as bad. But please make the defense good again i don't need my oppenents getting bailed out because of some blown coverage. If you just fix the defense i think you have one of the best maddens since 2015, i see ea actually put effort into the game this time. I would say it's worth to buy just don't expect much. ALSO thank you for fixing the loading screen animations it actually looks cool and not like you spent 3 dollars making it.

negative.review: The new features of this game are cool for like 2 hours and then you realize that the same dumb bullshit that has been in the last 6 maddens still isn't fixed. They add new features (which are literally just features that have been removed that are being added back), and literally just don't fix the core issues of the game. The blocking still doesn't work, players get stuck in animations, the ball phases through players, there is random people I have never heard of making insane acrobatic plays every time, the knock out system on catches is still really bad, receivers still get stuck on the o line and can't run their route, and the physics just don't work sometimes. This is THE ONLY simulation NFL game we have (and will have until 2030 and probably longer). It's even more frustrating when you remember that this game costs $70 and is complete junk.

In a year where Pokemon ZA is using 2D Playstation 2 cutouts for environments, this is still somehow the worst game a multi-billion dollar company has released. There isn't a single aspect, mode, or feature of the game that isn't unplayable or unusable due to bugs. Draft classes become entirely default white dudes with the same face and height. Superstar mode will delete your save files and often not even let you play. Editing a player's stats will freeze the game. Scrolling through rosters will remove team icons and player photos from the players. Looking at their player stats page will remove the usual background and their 3d model and just be a black screen with text. Madden Ultimate Team will have you pay hundreds of dollars for a card, you'll list it on the auction house, and it'll disappear without rewarding you with anything. If i listed every bug in this game, I would use up the entirety of Steam's cloud storage space.
